adjective.description: Of smell, taste, etc.: characteristic of a ram; rank, strong, pungent; disagreeable, offensive.
Having a pungent or disagreeable smell or taste. Now chiefly regional.

origin: Late Middle English; earliest use found in Geoffrey Chaucer (c1340–1400), poet and administrator. From ram + -ish<br>late 15th century; earliest use found in Craft of Deyng. Apparently originally a variant of ramage; in some forms perhaps partly influenced by rammish.
